question.para: How do I find package Foo?

answer.para:
Mostly, it's not hard, but some packages can lead quite a chase. Here are some steps:
: Searching for foo will usually turn up a freshmeat page with links to an URL where you can check for newer releases not reported to freshmeat.
: Use a search string like +foo +index which tends to find "Index of /pub/foo" type pages, or even +foo +index -RPM -debian to eliminate links to RPM packages and Debian's archives.
Google may well turn up a link to something under . (If you want to look specifically on ibiblio.org use foo site:ibiblio.org) Beware that ibiblio.org may not have the most recent version. However, they often will have...
A foo.lsm (Linux Software Map) file which may list a primary site where more recent versions may be found.
